page.title: 09CHARNES HALL BROUGHTON
page.content: CHARNES HALL BUILT IN 1690 IS ON ITS THIRD SITE,THE ORIGINAL BEING MENTIONED IN THE DOOMSDAY BOOK THE HALLHAS ONLY BEEN OWNED BY 2 FAMILIES SINCE THEN;THE PRESENT OWNER'S GRANDFARTHER HAVING BOUGHT IT WITH THE ESTATE IN 1917.WITH A WIFE AND 3 CHILDREN,THE OWNER OCCUPIES THE WHOLE HOUSE WHICH IS OF MANAGEABLE SIZE,HELP IN THE HOUSE IS GIVEN BY A HOUSEKEEPER WHO LIVES IN A COTTAGE AT THE REAR AND 2 WIVES OF ESTATE WORKERS,THERE ARE 2 GARNERS WHO LOOK AFTER A LARGE VEGETABLE GARDEN AND A SIMPLE BUT RAMBLING GARDEN,WHICH INCLUDES A GRAVEL DRIVE AND ROSE COVERED PERGOLA. THE OWNER SHARES THE LIVING OF CROXTON BROUGHTON AND ADBASTON CHURCHES WITH THE BISHOP OF LICHFIELD.HE IS ALSO AN ACTIVE MEMBER OF MANY VILLAGE COMMITTEES AND PLAYS A VITAL PART IN MAINTAINING VILLAGE LIFE.
